                         PROGRAMS

THERE IS A MORE DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF ALL THESE PROGRAMS IN THE
BEGINNING OF THE CODE:
MEMBER    DESCRIPTION
FOLDIT    PROGRAM FOR PRINTING DATA SETS WITH UPPER AND LOWER
          CASE CHARACTERS ON PRINTERS LACKING THE LUXURY OF LOWER CASE.
SMFSEL    THIS PROGRAM COPIES ONE SMF HISTORY TAPE TO ANOTHER BUT ALLOWS
          SELECTION  BY DATE (JULIAN) AND TIME (MILITARY 24 HR CLOCK).
          (FIXED BUG WITH DATE SELECTION)
DLXSUBMT  PROGRAM USED HERE AS A STC TO PROVIDE RACF PASSWORDS FOR
          OPERATIONS JOBS (PASSWORD DECRYPTION ROUTINE IS NOT MINE BUT
          IT DOES WORK FOR ANY LENGTH PASSWORD. I DO NOT PROFESS TO
          UNDERSTAND IT AND I HAVE CONVENIENTLY FORGOTTEN THE FINE
          GENTLEMAN WHO PROVIDED IT TO ME)
IKJEFF10  DOES APPROXIMATELY THE SAME THING AS DLXSUBMT EXCEPT IS THE
          A TSO SUBMIT EXIT. HAS A COUPLE OF MINOR LIMITATIONS, MAINLY
          THAT THE PASSWORD FIELD MUST HAVE EXACTLY THE SAME NUMBER OF
          QUESTION MARKS AS THE USERS PASSWORD HAS CHARACTERS. IF ANY
          ON FIXES THAT PLEASE GIVE ME A CALL I AM SHORT OF TIME.
DLXPOST   SLOPPY BUT IT DOES ALLOW PRINTING OF MOST PRINT TYPE FILES ON
          A 6670 USING OCL FROM SYSIN. (DOCUMENTATION IS CURRENTLY A
          LITTLE DEFICIENT)

ABRARCH1.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%--------------------  ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY ---------------------- --------
% COMMAND ===>_ZCMD          +                                                 +
%
+   DATA SET NAME  %===>_ADSN                                        +
%
+   DATA SET GROUP %===>_ADSG                                        +
%
+   OPTIONAL
+     VOLUME       %===>_AVOL  +
%
+     VOLUME GROUP %===>_AVOLG +
%
)INIT
  .HELP = TABRARC1
)PROC
  IF (&ADSN = ' ')
    VER (&ADSG,NONBLANK,MSG=ABR000)
  IF (&ADSN ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ADSG,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR001)
  IF (&AVOL ¬= ' ')
    VER (&AVOLG,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR001R)
  IF (&AVOLG ¬= ' ')
    VER (&AVOL,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR001R)
)END

ABRARCH2.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%------------  RESTORE FROM ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY  -------------------------
% COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                            +
%
+   DATA SET NAME  %===>_ADSN                                        +
%
+   DATA SET GROUP %===>_ADSG                                        +
%
+   OPTIONAL
+     ARCHIVE DATE %===>_ADATE+        JULIAN DATE FORM YYDDD
+     CYLINDERS    %===>_ACYL+
+     NEWNAME      %===>_ANDSN                                       +
+     NEWGROUP     %===>_ANDSG                                       +
+     NEW VOLUME   %===>_ANVOL +
+     TRACKS       %===>_ATRK+
+     VOLUME       %===>_AVOL  +
+     VOLUME GROUP %===>_AVOLG +
%
)INIT
  .HELP = TABRARC2
)PROC
  IF (&ADSN = ' ')
    VER (&ADSG,NONBLANK,MSG=ABR002)
  IF (&ADSN ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ADSG,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR003)
  IF (&ADATE ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ADATE,PICT,'NNNNN',MSG=ABR004)
    VER (&ADATE,RANGE,1,99366,MSG=ABR005)
  IF (&ACYL ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ACYL,NUM,MSG=ABR006)
  IF (&ANDSN ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ANDSG,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR007)
  IF (&ANDSG ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ANDSN,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR007)
  IF (&ATRK ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ATRK,NUM,MSG=ABR008)
)END

ABRBKUP2.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%--------------  RESTORE FROM BACKUP SELECTION UTILITY  ------------------------
% COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                            +
%
+   DATA SET NAME  %===>_ADSN                                        +
%
+   OPTIONAL
+     CYCLE NUMBER %===>_ACYCLE+        CYCLE NUMBER FORM NN
+     CYLINDERS    %===>_ACYL+
+     GENERATION   %===>_AGEN+          GENERATION NUMBER FORM NNNN
+     NEWNAME      %===>_ANDSN                                       +
+     NEWGROUP     %===>_ANDSG                                       +
+     NEW VOLUME   %===>_ANVOL +
+     TRACKS       %===>_ATRK+
+     VOLUME       %===>_AVOL  +
%
)INIT
  .HELP = TABRBKU2
)PROC
  VER (&ADSN,NONBLANK,MSG=ABR001B)
  IF (&ACYCLE ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ACYCLE,PICT,'NN',MSG=ABR001C)
    VER (&ACYCLE,RANGE,0,63,MSG=ABR001D)
  IF (&ACYL ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ACYL,NUM,MSG=ABR001E)
  IF (&AGEN ¬= ' ')
    VER (&AGEN,PICT,'NNNN',MSG=ABR001F)
    VER (&AGEN,RANGE,1,9999,MSG=ABR001G)
  IF (&ANDSN ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ANDSG,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR001H)
  IF (&ANDSG ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ANDSN,LIST,' ',MSG=ABR001I)
  IF (&ATRK ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ATRK,NUM,MSG=ABR001J)
)END

ABRRPT1.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%----------------------  ARCHIVE REPORT UTILITY  -------------------------------
% COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                            +
+
+DISPLAY/PRINT %===>_LISTOPT+ BLANK TO BROWSE AND DELETE, P TO BROWSE AND PRINT
+ SYSOUT CLASS %===>_ACLA   + SYSOUT CLASS (IF DISPLAY/PRINT OPTION IS   P)
+
+REPORT OPTIONS:      (ALL OPERANDS ARE OPTIONAL, DEFAULT IS A FULL REPORT)
+
+DATASET NAME  %===>_ADSN                                        +
+DATASET GROUP %===>_ADSG                                        +
+EXPIRED       %===>_AEXP+       YES, NO, OR BLANK (BLANK IS DEFAULT)
+RESTORED      %===>_AREST+      YES OR BLANK (BLANK IS DEFAULT)
+DELETED       %===>_ADELT+      YES OR BLANK (BLANK IS DEFAULT)
+START DATE    %===>_ASDATE+     JULIAN DATA FORMAT YYDDD
+VOLUME        %===>_AVOL                                     +
+VOLUME GROUP  %===>_AVOLG                                    +
)INIT
  .HELP = TABRRPT1
)PROC
  IF (&LISTOPT ¬= ' ')
     VER (&ACLA,NONBLANK,MSG=ABR001Q)
  IF (&AEXP ¬= ' ')
    VER (&AEXP,LIST,YES,NO,MSG=ABR001J)
  IF (&AREST ¬= ' ')
    VER (&AREST,LIST,YES,MSG=ABR001K)
  IF (&ADELT ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ADELT,LIST,YES,MSG=ABR001K)
  IF (&ASDATE ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ASDATE,PICT,NNNNN,MSG=ABR001L)
    VER (&ASDATE,RANGE,0,99366,MSG=ABR001M)
)END

)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%------------------------- VTOC REPORT UTILITY  --------------------------------
% COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                            +
+
+DISPLAY/PRINT %===>_LISTOPT+ BLANK TO BROWSE AND DELETE, P TO BROWSE AND PRINT
+ SYSOUT CLASS %===>_ACLA   + SYSOUT CLASS (IF DISPLAY/PRINT OPTION IS   P)
+
+REPORT OPTIONS:      (ALL OPERANDS ARE OPTIONAL, DEFAULT IS A FULL REPORT)
+
+DATASET NAME  %===>_ADSN
+
+DATASET GROUP %===>_ADSG
+
+COMBINE       %===>_ACOMB   +(MERGE DISK VOLUMES INTO ONE REPORT.)
+                            +(SPECIFY 'YES' OR LEAVE BLANK.)
+VOLUME        %===>_AVOL                                     +
+
+VOLUME GROUP  %===>_AVOLG                                    +
+
+XREF          %===>_AXREF   +(RECOVERY INFORMATION BY DATASET NAME.)
+                            +(SPECIFY 'YES' OR LEAVE BLANK.)
)INIT
  .HELP = TABRRPT4
)PROC
  VER (&LISTOPT,LIST,' ','P',MSG=ABR001N)
  IF (&LISTOPT ¬= ' ')
    VER (&ACLA,NONBLANK,MSG=ABR001Q)
  VER (&ACOMB,LIST,' ','YES','Y',MSG=ABR001O)
  VER (&AXREF,LIST,' ','YES','Y',MSG=ABR001P)
)END

ABRSEL.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%------------------  FDR ABR FUNCTION SELECTION MENU  --------------------------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
%   1+-%ARCHIVE+FUNCTIONS
%   2+-%BACKUP+FUNCTIONS
%   3+- ARCHIVE, BACKUP, AND VOLUME%REPORTS+
%
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX = ISR91000 /* TUTORIAL INDEX - 1ST PAGE         */
)PROC
  &ZSEL = TRANS( TRUNC (&ZCMD,'.')
                1,'PANEL(ABRSELA)'
                2,'PANEL(ABRSELB)'
                3,'PANEL(ABRSELP)'
              ' ',' '
                *,'?' )
)END

)ATTR

)BODY

%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +

+
+COMPILER OPTIONS:       (TERM IS A DEFAULT)

+                        (NOSOURCE IS GENERATED IF LISTER OPTIONS ARE PRESENT)
+COMPILER COPY LIBRARIES TO BE CONCATENATED IN FRONT OF DLX1.COBCOPY.COBOL
+             THESE MUST BE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAMES
+
+COBCOPY1%===>_SLIB1                                                       +
+COBCOPY2%===>_SLIB2                                                       +
+COBCOPY3%===>_SLIB3                                                       +
+COBCOPY4%===>_SLIB4                                                       +
)END

ISR@PRIM.text:
%-----------------------  ISPF/PDF PRIMARY OPTION MENU  ------------------------
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%                                                           +USERID   - &ZUSER
%   0 +ISPF PARMS  - Specify terminal and user parameters   +TIME     - &ZTIME
%   1 +BROWSE      - Display source data or output listings +TERMINAL - &ZTERM
%   2 +EDIT        - Create or change source data           +PF KEYS  - &ZKEYS
%   3 +UTILITIES   - Perform utility functions              +DATE     - &ZDATE
%   4 +FOREGROUND  - Invoke foreground language processors  +JULIAN   - &ZJDATE
%   5 +BATCH       - Submit job for language processing
%   6 +COMMAND     - Enter TSO command or CLIST
%   7 +DIALOG TEST - Perform dialog testing
%   8 +USER1       - Perform user utility functions
%   A +ABR         - Perform archive and backup utility functions
%   B +USER2       - Deluxe background compile and linkedit
%   C +CHANGES     - Display summary of changes for this release
%   I +INFOSYS     - Information/system functions
%   S +SCRIPT      - Deluxe script functions
%   T +TUTORIAL    - Display information about ISPF/PDF
%   X +EXIT        - Terminate ISPF using log and list defaults
+Enter%END+command to terminate ISPF.
%
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZPRIM = YES        /* ALWAYS A PRIMARY OPTION MENU      */
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX = ISR91000 /* TUTORIAL INDEX - 1ST PAGE         */
)PROC
  &ZSEL = TRANS( TRUNC (&ZCMD,'.')
                0,'PANEL(ISPOPTA)'
                1,'PGM(ISRBRO)'
                2,'PGM(ISREDIT)'
                3,'PANEL(ISRUTIL)'
                4,'PANEL(ISRFPA)'
                5,'PGM(ISRJB1) PARM(ISRJPA) NOCHECK'
                6,'PGM(ISRPTC)'
                7,'PGM(ISRYXDR) NOCHECK'
                8,'PANEL(USERSEL)'
                A,'PANEL(ABRSEL)'
                B,'CMD(USERSELB)'
                C,'PGM(ISPTUTOR) PARM(ISR00005)'
                G,'PANEL(GAME1)'
                I,'PANEL(INFOSEL)'
                S,'PANEL(SCRPSEL)'
                T,'PGM(ISPTUTOR) PARM(ISR00000)'
              ' ',' '
                X,'EXIT'
                *,'?' )
  &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
)END

)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%------------------------  FOREGROUND COMPARE  ---------------------------------
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+ THIS OPTION OF ISPF WILL ALLOW YOU TO OPTIONALLY CHANGE, AND THEN
+ COMPARE TWO SEQUENTIAL (OR SEQUENTIAL-LIKE) DATASETS
+ NOTE:  ALL DATASET NAMES MUST BE FULLY QUALIFIED
%
+   INPUT DATASET NAME 1  %===>_INDSN1
+   INPUT RECORD LENGTH 1 %===>_INLR1+ (REQUIRED IF CHANGING LRECL)
+   OUTPUT RECORD LENGTH 1%===>_OUTLR1+(REQUIRED IF CHANGING LRECL)
+   SORT FIELDS 1         %===>_SRTFLDS1                          +
+
+   INPUT DATASET NAME 2  %===>_INDSN2
+   INPUT RECORD LENGTH 2 %===>_INLR2+ (REQUIRED IF CHANGING LRECL)
+   OUTPUT RECORD LENGTH 2%===>_OUTLR2+(REQUIRED IF CHANGING LRECL)
+   SORT FIELDS 2         %===>_SRTFLDS2                          +
+
% ENTER PARAMETERS DESCRIBING THE CHANGE YOU WISH MADE TO THE INPUT DATASET
%      DATASET 1                               DATASET 2
+ FIRST START POSITION  %===>_STPOS11+    FIRST START POSITION  %===>_STPOS21+
+ FIRST FIELD LENGTH    %===>_FLNGTH11+   FIRST FIELD LENGTH    %===>_FLNGTH21+
+ SECOND START POSITION %===>_STPOS12+    SECOND START POSITION %===>_STPOS22+
+ SECOND FIELD LENGTH   %===>_FLNGTH12+   SECOND FIELD LENGTH   %===>_FLNGTH22+
+ THIRD START POSITION  %===>_STPOS13+    THIRD START POSITION  %===>_STPOS23+
+ THIRD FIELD LENGTH    %===>_FLNGTH13+   THIRD FIELD LENGTH    %===>_FLNGTH23+
)INIT
  .HELP = TPLTCMP1

PSWDSEL.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%------------------  DELUXE PASSWORD MAINTENANCE MENU  -------------------------
%SELECT OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                       +
%
%   1+-ADD        - ADD A NEW PASSWORD TO A DATASET
%   2+-CHANGE     - CHANGE AN EXISTING PASSWORD ON A DATASET
%   3+-DELETE     - DELETE AN EXISTING PASSWORD FROM A DATASET
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX = ISR91000 /* TUTORIAL INDEX - 1ST PAGE         */
)PROC
  &ZSEL = TRANS( TRUNC (&ZCMD,'.')
                1,'CMD(ADDPASS)'
                2,'CMD(CHNGPASS)'
                3,'CMD(DELPASS)'
              ' ',' '
                *,'?' )
)END

PWADD.text:
)ATTR
   %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
   +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
   _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)
   ¬  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(NON) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)
)BODY
---------------------------  PASSWORD ADD  -------------------------------------
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+ ENTER DATASET NAME%===>_DSNAMEIN                                    +
+ ENTER PASSWORD    %===>¬NEWPW   +
+ READ PROTECTION   %===>_PWREADIN+ ENTER A Y FOR READ PROTECTION
+ CONTROL PASSWORD  %===>¬CPW     + NECESSARY IF THE PASSWORD TO BE
+                                   ADDED IS NOT THE FIRST PASSWORD TO BE
+                                   ASSIGNED TO THE DATASET
)END

PWCHNG.text:
)ATTR
   %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
   +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
   _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)
   ¬  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(NON) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)
)BODY
-------------------------  PASSWORD CHANGE  ------------------------------------
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+ ENTER DATASET NAME%===>_DSNAMEIN                                    +
+ ENTER OLD PASSWORD%===>¬OLDPW   +
+ ENTER NEW PASSWORD%===>¬NEWPW   +
+ CONTROL PASSWORD  %===>¬CPW     + NECESSARY IF THE PASSWORD TO BE
+                                   CHANGED WAS NOT THE FIRST PASSWORD
+                                   ASSIGNED TO THE DATASET
)END

PWDEL.text:
)ATTR
   %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
   +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
   _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)
   ¬  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(NON) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)
)BODY
-------------------------  PASSWORD DELETE  ------------------------------------
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
+ ENTER DATASET NAME%===>_DSNAMEIN                                    +
+ ENTER PASSWORD    %===>¬DELPW   + PASSWORD TO BE DELETED
+ CONTROL PASSWORD  %===>¬CPW     + NECESSARY IF THE PASSWORD TO BE
+                                   DELETED WAS NOT THE FIRST PASSWORD
+                                   ASSIGNED TO THE DATASET
)END

TABRARC1.text:
%TUTORIAL ------------  ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY  ---------------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
+
  THE ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY IS USED TO SET THE%ABR+ARCHIVEING
  INDICATOR FOR SELECTED DATASETS OR GROUPS OF DATASETS.

% DATASET NAME+  THIS IS THE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAME OF THE
                 DATASET YOU WISH TO BE ARCHIVED.  THE DEFAULT IS TO
                 USE THE DATASET GROUP SPECIFICATION.

% DATASET GROUP+ SPECIFIES A STRING OF CHARACTERS WHICH IDENTIFY A
                 GROUP OF DATASETS YOU WISH ARCHIVED.

% NOTE:+ EITHER DATASET NAME OR DATASET GROUP%MUST+ BE SPECIFIED.

                  (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
  &ZCONT = TABRARCA
)END

TABRARC2.text:
%TUTORIAL ----  RESTORE FROM ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY  ----------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
+
  THE RESTORE FROM ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY IS USED TO SELECT DATA SETS
  OR GROUPS OF DATA SETS THAT HAVE PREVIOUSLY BEEN%ARCHIVED+ FOR RESTORE
  PROCESSING.  THE DATA SET(S) SELECTED WILL BE RESTORED AT THE TIME OF
  THE NEXT%ARCHIVE RESTORE+RUN.

% DATASET NAME+  THIS IS THE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAME OF THE
                 DATASET YOU WISH TO BE RESTORED.

% DATASET GROUP+ SPECIFIES A STRING OF CHARACTERS WHICH IDENTIFY A
                 GROUP OF DATASETS YOU WISH RESTORED.

% NOTE:+ EITHER DATASET NAME OR DATASET GROUP%MUST+ BE SPECIFIED.

+            THE FOLLOWING OPERANDS ARE OPTIONAL AND SERVE TO FURTHER
             IDENTIFY WHICH DATASET(S) YOU WISH SELECTED.

% ARCHIVE DATE+  SPECIFIES THE JULIAN DATE THAT A DATASET WAS ARCHIVED.
                 THIS IS USED TO FURTHER IDENTIFY AN ARCHIVED DATASET.
                 DEFAULT WITH DATASET GROUP IS THE%OLDEST+COPY OF THE DATASET.
                  (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
  &ZCONT = TABRARC3
)END

TABRARC3.text:
%TUTORIAL ----  RESTORE FROM ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY  ----------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+                       (CONTINUED FROM PREVIOUS PAGE)
+
% CYLINDERS +    IF%ABR+IS TO ALLOCATE THE DATA SET, SPECIFIES THE
                 NUMBER OF CYLINDERS FOR SPACE ALLOCATION.  THIS VALUE
                 OVERRIDES THE ACTUAL SIZE OF THE DATA SET THAT WAS
                 DUMPED.  ON SEQUENTIAL OR PARTITIONED SEQUENTIAL FILES
                 THIS VALUE MUST BE AT LEAST THE LAST BLOCK POINTER
                 (WHICH SPECIFIES ONE LESS THAN THE NUMBER OF TRACKS
                 USED) PLUS ONE TRACK, DIVIDED BY THE NUMBER OF TRACKS
                 PER CYLINDER AND ROUNDED UP.

% NEWNAME +      SPECIFIES THAT THE DATA SET IS TO BE RESTORED TO A NEW
                 DATA SET NAME. IF THIS NEW DATA SET IS NOT ALLOCATED,  S
                 %ABR+WILL ALLOCATE IT.  THIS OPERAND MAY NOT BE USED IN
                 WITH THE DATA SET GROUP OPERAND.

% NEWGROUP+      SPECIFIES THAT THE DATA SET(S) IS(ARE) TO BE RESTORED
                 USING A NEW GROUP NAME.  THE NUMBER OF CHARACTERS SPECIFIED
                 WILL REPLACE THE SAME NUMBER LEFT TO RIGHT IN THE DATA SET
                 NAME.  NEWGROUP MUST NOT BE LONGER THAN THE DATASET GROUP NAME.

                  (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
  &ZCONT = TABRARC4
)END

TABRARC4.text:
%TUTORIAL ----  RESTORE FROM ARCHIVE SELECTION UTILITY  ----------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+                       (CONTINUED FROM PREVIOUS PAGE)
+
% NEW VOLUME+    SPECIFIES THE VOLUME THIS DATASET IS TO BE RESTORED
                 TO.  IF NOT SPECIFIED, THE CATALOG WILL BE SEARCHED FOR
                 THE DATA SET NAME.  IF NOT FOUND ON THE CATALOG, THE
                 DATASET WILL BE RESTORED TO ONE OF THE VOLUMES
                 ALLOCATED DURING THE ACTUAL RESTORE RUN.

% TRACKS +       IF%ABR+IS TO ALLOCATE THE DATA SET, SPECIFIES THE
                 NUMBER OF TRACKS FOR SPACE ALLOCATION.  THIS VALUE
                 OVERRIDES THE ACTUAL SIZE OF THE DATA SET THAT WAS
                 DUMPED.  ON SEQUENTIAL OR PARTITIONED SEQUENTIAL FILES
                 THIS VALUE MUST BE AT LEAST THE LAST BLOCK POINTER
                 (WHICH SPECIFIES ONE LESS THAN THE NUMBER OF TRACKS
                 USED) PLUS ONE TRACK.

                  (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
  &ZCONT = TABRARCB
)END

TABRARC5.text:
%TUTORIAL -  RESET ARCHIVE SELECTION INDICATORS UTILITY  ---------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
+
  THE RESET ARCHIVE SELECTION INDICATORS UTILITY IS USED TO REMOVE THE
  ARCHIVE INDICATORS FROM THE DATASET OF DATASET GROUP SPECIFIED.

% DATASET NAME+  THIS IS THE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAME OF THE
                 DATASET YOU NO LONGER WISH TO BE ARCHIVED.  THE DEFAULT
                 IS TO USE THE DATASET GROUP SPECIFICATION.

% DATASET GROUP+ SPECIFIES A STRING OF CHARACTERS WHICH IDENTIFY A
                 GROUP OF DATASETS YOU NO LONGER WISH ARCHIVED

% NOTE:+ EITHER DATASET NAME OR DATASET GROUP%MUST+ BE SPECIFIED.

                  (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
  &ZCONT = TABRARCC
)END

TABRARC6.text:

%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
+
  THE REMOVE FROM ARCHIVE RESTORE QUEUE UTILITY IS USED TO REMOVE
  PREVIOUS REQUESTS FROM THE ARCHIVE RESTORE QUEUE.  (POSSIBLY TO
  PREVENT RESTORING A DATASET WHICH WAS REQUESTED FOR RESTORE
  BY MISTAKE).

% DATASET NAME+  THIS IS THE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAME OF THE
                 DATASET YOU NO LONGER WISH TO BE RESTORED.  THE DEFAULT
                 IS TO USE THE DATASET GROUP SPECIFICATION.

% DATASET GROUP+ SPECIFIES A STRING OF CHARACTERS WHICH IDENTIFY A
                 GROUP OF DATASETS YOU NO LONGER WISH RESTORED

% NOTE:+ EITHER DATASET NAME OR DATASET GROUP%MUST+ BE SPECIFIED.

                  (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
  &ZCONT = TABRARCD
)END

TABRARC7.text:
%TUTORIAL-------  DELETE DATASETS FROM THE ARCHIVE  --------------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
+
  THE DELETE FROM ARCHIVE UTILITY IS USED TO SET THE DELETION INDICATOR
  ON SELECTED DATASET'S RECORDS IN THE ARCHIVE CONTROL FILE.  THESE
  DATASETS WILL NO LONGER APPEAR IN ARCHIVE REPORTS AND THE RECORDS FOR
  THEM WILL BE DELETED AT THE NEXT REORGINIZATION OF THE ARCHIVE CONTROL
  FILE.

% DATASET NAME+  THIS IS THE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAME OF THE DATASET
                 IN THE ARCHIVE YOU NO LONGER WISH A RECORD KEPT FOR.

% DATASET GROUP+ SPECIFIES A STRING OF CHARACTERS WHICH IDENTIFY A GROUP
                 OF DATASETS IN THE ARCHIVE YOU NO LONGER WISH A RECORD
                 KEPT FOR.

% NOTE:+ EITHER DATASET NAME OR DATASET GROUP%MUST+ BE SPECIFIED.
)END

TABRARC8.text:
%TUTORIAL-----  RESET DELETE INDICATOR ON ARCHIVED DATASETS  -----------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
+
  THE RESET DELETE INDICATOR ON ARCHIVED DATASETS UTILITIY IS USED TO
  RESET THE INDICATOR SET BY THE DELETE ARCHIVED DATASET UTILITY ON
  SELECTED DATASET'S RECORDS IN THE ARCHIVE CONTROL FILE.

% DATASET NAME+  THIS IS THE FULLY QUALIFIED DATASET NAME OF THE DATASET
                 IN THE ARCHIVE PREVIOUSLY SET FOR DELETE THAT YOU NOW
                 WISH TO KEEP.

% DATASET GROUP+ SPECIFIES A STRING OF CHARACTERS WHICH IDENTIFY A GROUP
                 OF DATASETS IN THE ARCHIVE PREVIOUSLY SET FOR DELETE
                 THAT YOU NOW WISH TO KEEP.

% NOTE:+ EITHER DATASET NAME OR DATASET GROUP%MUST+ BE SPECIFIED.
)END

TABRBKU3.text:
%TUTORIAL ----  RESTORE FROM BACKUP SELECTION UTILITY  -----------------TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +

+
% CYLINDERS +    IF%ABR+IS TO ALLOCATE THE DATA SET, SPECIFIES THE
                 NUMBER OF CYLINDERS FOR SPACE ALLOCATION.  THIS VALUE

                 (WHICH SPECIFIES ONE LESS THAN THE NUMBER OF TRACKS

% GENERATION+    SPECIFIES THE GENERATION NUMBER OF THE BACKUP%ABR+IS TO
                 USE TO RESTORE THIS DATASET.  IF%GEN+IS USED%CYCLE+MUSTS
                 ALSE BE SPECIFIED.  THESE VALUES ARE PRINTED IN THE%ABR
                +REPORTS.

% NEWNAME +      SPECIFIES THAT THE DATA SET IS TO BE RESTORED TO A NEW
                 DATA SET NAME. IF THIS NEW DATA SET IS NOT ALLOCATED,  S
                 %ABR+WILL ALLOCATE IT.  THIS OPERAND MAY NOT BE USED IN

% NEW VOLUME+    SPECIFIES THE VOLUME THIS DATASET IS TO BE RESTORED

TPLTCMP1.text:
%TUTORIAL ----------------- COMPARE UTILITY --------------------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
% THE COMPARE UTILITY WILL OPTIONALLY CHANGE THE FORMAT OF A DATASET
% AND THEN COMPARE IT TO A CONTROL DATASET.
+
+ THE CONTROL FLOW OF THE UTILITY IS A FOLLOWS:
+    IF THE%FIRST START POSITION+FIELD IS NON-BLANK THE UTILITY
+    ASSUMES THAT YOU WISH TO CHANGE THE INPUT RECORD BEFORE COMPARE.
+    THE INPUT AND OUTPUT LRECL FIELDS%MUST+BE NON-BLANK.
+    THE UTILITY WILL THEN INVOKE%SYNCSORT+USING THE FOLLOWING
+    CONTROL CARDS:
%        SORT FIELDS=COPY
%        RECORD TYPE=F,LENGTH=(L1)   +(WHERE L1 = INPUT RECORD LENGTH)
%        OUTREC FIELDS=(P1,L1,P2,L2,P3,P3)
+                      WHERE P(N) = START POSITION (N) AND
+                      WHERE L(N) = FIELD LENGTH (N)
+    AFTER SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF%SYNCSORT+OR IMMEDIATELY IF THE
+    INPUT RECORD WAS NOT BEING CHANGED THE UTILITY WILL INVOKE THE
+    IBM UTILITY%IEBCOMPR+WITH SYSUT1 BEING THE DATASET NUMBERED%1+AND
+    SYSUT2 BEING THE DATASET NUMBERED%2+.  THE SYSPRINT OUTPUT FROM%IEBCOMPR+
+    (IF ANY) WILL THEN BE AVAILABLE FOR YOU TO BROWSE.
+
+                CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE
)PROC
   &ZCONT=TPLTCMP2
)END

TPLTCMP2.text:
%TUTORIAL ----------------- COMPARE UTILITY --------------------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
%                              CONTINUED
+
+    IF%IEBCOMPR+FINDS NO DIFFERENCES THE UTILITY WILL DISPLAY THE MESSAGE
+    %SUCCESSFUL COMPARE+ IN THE UPPER RIGHT HAND CORNER OF YOUR SCREEN.
+
+    IF THE%SORT FIELDS 1+OR%SORT FIELDS 2+FIELD IS NON-BLANK THE UTILITY
+    ASSUMES THAT YOU WISH TO CHANGE THE INPUT RECORD ORDER BEFORE COMPARE.
+    THE UTILITY WILL THEN SUBSTITUTE YOUR SORT FIELDS SPECIFICATIONS
+    INSTEAD OF ASSUMING FIELDS EQUALS COPY.  A SHORT EXAMPLE FOLLOWS.
+
+   SORT FIELDS 1         %===>
+    WILL GENERATE THE FOLLWING SORT CONTROL CARD:
%        SORT FIELDS=COPY
+
+   SORT FIELDS 1         %===> (1,2,A,6,2,A),FORMAT=CH
+    WILL GENERATE THE FOLLWING SORT CONTROL CARD:
%        SORT FIELDS=(1,2,A,6,2,A),FORMAT=CH
)END

TVTOCK.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%NEXT SELECTION ===>_ZCMD                                                      +
+
%              ------------------------------------------------
               |  LIST OF VALID KEYWORDS FOR THE VTOC UTILITY |
               ------------------------------------------------

              ALLOC      DATA SET ALLOCATION
                            NUMBER OF KILOBYTES, TRACKS,
                            CYLINDERS, OR MEGABYTES ALLOCATED.
                            DEFAULT IS KILOBYTES.
              UNUSED     AMOUNT OF UNUSED SPACE IN THE DATA
                            SET.  SAME UNITS AS IN ALLOC.
              USED       AMOUNT OF SPACE USED IN THE DATA SET.
                            SAME UNITS AS IN ALLOC.
              PCT        PERCENTAGE OF SPACE USED IN THE DATA
                            USED.
              EX         NUMBER OF EXTENTS IN THE DATA SET.
              DSO        DATA SET ORGANIZATION
                            PS = SEQUENTIAL   PO = PARTITIONED
                            VS = VSAM         IS = ISAM
                            DA = DIRECT ACCESS  U = UNMOVEABLE

                    (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOCK1
)END

TVTOCK1.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%NEXT SELECTION ===>_ZCMD                                                      +
+
%              ------------------------------------------------
               |  LIST OF VALID KEYWORDS FOR THE VTOC UTILITY |
               |                   CONTINUED                  |
               ------------------------------------------------

              RFM        RECORD FORMAT
                            F  = FIXED        V  = VARIABLE
                            U  = UNDEFINED    B  = BLOCKED
                            T  = TRACK OVERFLOW
                            S  = SPANNED OR STANDARD
                            A  = ASA CARRIAGE CONTROL
                            M  = MACHINE CARRIAGE CONTROL
              BLKSZ      BLOCKSIZE FOR PHYSICAL BLOCKS OF
                            DATA.
              LRECL      LOGICAL RECORD LENGTH IN BYTES.
              CDATE      CREATION DATE IN THE FORM YYDDD,
                            SOMETIMES CALLED JULIAN.
              EXPDT      EXPIRATION DATE IN THE SAME FORM.
                            THIS FIELD IS RARELY USED HERE.

                    (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOCK2
)END

TVTOCK2.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%NEXT SELECTION ===>_ZCMD                                                      +
+
%              ------------------------------------------------
               |  LIST OF VALID KEYWORDS FOR THE VTOC UTILITY |
               |                   CONTINUED                  |
               ------------------------------------------------

              REFDT      LAST USE DATE IN THE SAME FORM.
                            THIS DATE IS WHEN THE DATA SET WAS
                            LAST OPENED.
              SECT       TYPE OF ALLOCATION
                            A  = ABSOLUTE TRACK
                            B  = BLOCKS
                            T  = TRACKS
                            C  = CYLINDERS
              PASS       PROTECTION INDICATORS
                            N  = NONE
                            R  = READ AND WRITE PROTECTION
                            W  = WRITE PROTECTION

                    (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOCK3
)END

TVTOCK3.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%NEXT SELECTION ===>_ZCMD                                                      +
+
%              ------------------------------------------------
               |  LIST OF VALID KEYWORDS FOR THE VTOC UTILITY |
               |                   CONTINUED                  |
               ------------------------------------------------

              ROUND      SPACE ROUNDED UP TO CYLINDERS
                            R  = ROUND  N  = NO ROUND
              CCHH       CYLINDER AND HEAD ADDRESS, IN 4 OR 8
                            HEXADECIMAL DIGITS.  IF 4 DIGITS
                            ARE USED, ONLY THE CYLINDER IS USED
                            FOR COMPARISON, OTHERWISE, THE CYL
                            AND TRACK ARE COMPARED.
              VOLUME     VOLUME SERIAL NUMBER OR DISK NAME
              DSNAME     NAME OF THE DATA SET
                CAT      A LOCATE IS DONE FOR EACH DSNAME ON THEVOLUMES
                         LISTED AND STATUS IS INDICATED.  NOTE -  THIS
                         OPTION USES A LARGE AMOUNT OF PROCESSING TIME.
                         C - CATALOGGED ON THIS VOLUME
                         N - NOT CATALOGGED
                         W - CATALOGGED ON ANOTHER VOLUME
                         E - CATALOG PROCESSING ERROR
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOCO
)END

TVTOCO.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%NEXT SELECTION ===>_ZCMD                                                      +
+
%              ------------------------------------------------
               | LIST OF VALID OPERATORS FOR THE VTOC UTILITY |
               ------------------------------------------------

                      OPERATOR.  MEANING
                        EQ       IS EQUAL TO
                        NE       IS NOT EQUAL TO
                        LE       IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO
                        LT       IS LESS THAN
                        GE       IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO
                        GT       IS GREATER THAN
)PROC
  &ZCONT = ISR91000
)END

TVTOC1.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%NEXT SELECTION ===>_ZCMD                                                      +
+
%
  THE VTOC UTILITY DISPLAYS SELECTED DATA SETS ON A DISK OR SET OF
  DISKS.  EACH DISK HAS A VOLUME TABLE OF CONTENTS ( VTOC ).  THIS
  TABLE IS SEARCHED FOR DATA SETS THAT MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS.

  VOLUME      A VOLUME SERIAL NUMBER OR A LIST OF VOLUMES.
              IF THE FIRST ONE TO FIVE CHARACTERS OF A VOLUME
              SERIAL NUMBER ARE ENTERED, ALL VOLUMES THAT ARE
              MOUNTED ON THE MACHINE WHICH START WITH THOSE
              CHARACTERS WILL BE LISTED.
              IF 'ALL' IS SPECIFIED, ALL VOLUMES
              WHICH ARE ONLINE AND READY WILL BE PROCESSED.

  LEVEL  SPECIFIES THE HIGH LEVEL QUALIFIERS TO BE
         SEARCHED.  THIS WILL NOT BE PREFIXED BY YOUR USERID OR
         PREFIX.  ONLY DATA SETS STARTING WITH THESE PREFIXES WILL
         BE LISTED.

                     (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOC2
)END

TVTOC2.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
%                              CONTINUED
%
  CONTAINING   SPECIFIES A CHARACTER STRING CONTAINED
               IN THE DATA SET NAME.  AT LEAST ONE OF THE STRINGS MUST
               BE IN THE DSNAME FOR THE DATA SET TO BE LISTED.
               THESE STRINGS MUST CONFORM TO DSNAME STANDARDS.
               THEY CANNOT BEGIN WITH A PERIOD OR A NUMBER.

  ENDING       SPECIFIES THE ENDING CHARACTERS OF THE DSNAME.
               THE FINAL NONBLANK CHARACTERS OF THE DSNAME MUST
               BE ONE OF THESE STRINGS TO ALLOW THE DATA SET TO BE
               LISTED.  THESE STRINGS MUST CONFORM TO DSNAME STANDARDS.

  CAT          A LOCATE IS DONE FOR EACH DSNAME ON THE VOLUMES LISTED
               AND STATUS IS INDICATED.  NOTE -  THIS OPTION USES A
               CONSIDERABLE AMOUNT OF PROCESSING TIME.
               C -  CATALOGGED ON THIS VOLUME
               N -  NOT CATALOGGED
               W -  CATALOGGED ON ANOTHER VOLUME
               E -  CATALOG PROCESSING ERROR

                     (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOC3
)END

TVTOC3.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL ------------------- VTOC UTILITY ---------------------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION ===>_ZCMD                                                              +
+
%                               CONTINUED

  NOSORT      THE DATA SETS ARE NOT SORTED.  THEY ARE OUTPUT AS THEY
              ARE FOUND.

  SORT        DATA SETS ARE SORTED INTO ALPHABETICAL ORDER,
              BASED UPON THE SORT FIELDS SPECIFIED.
              DSNAME,VOLUME,ALLOC,USED,UNUSED,PCT,EX,DSO,RFM,
              LRECL,BLKSZ,CDATE,EXPDT,REFDT ARE VALID SORT FIELDS.
              'A/D'   ARE REQUIRED AFTER EACH SORT FIELD TO INDICATE
              ASCENDING/DESCENDING SEQUENCE.

  LIMIT1 - 4  SPECIFIES WHICH DATA SETS ARE TO
              BE LISTED.  ONLY DATA SETS THAT SATISFY THE RELATION
              ARE LISTED.
                     (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
)PROC
   &ZCONT = TVTOCK
)END

USERSEL.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%---------------------  USER OPTIONS SELECTION MENU  ---------------------------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
%   1+- VTOC UTILITY DISPLAY AND/OR LIST
%   2+- FOREGROUND COBOL COMPILER
%   3+- FOREGROUND LINKAGE EDITOR
%   4+- FOREGROUND CHANGE AND COMPARE (FOR PLANT NUMBER CONVERSION)
%   5+- PASSWORD MAINTENANCE
%   6+- SERIES 1 FOREGROUND ASSEMBLER
%   7+- SERIES 1 FOREGROUND OBJECT PUNCHING
%   8+- FOREGROUND IEBGENER
%
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX = ISR91000 /* TUTORIAL INDEX - 1ST PAGE         */
)PROC
  &ZSEL = TRANS( TRUNC (&ZCMD,'.')
                1,'CMD(VTOCCMD1)'
                2,'CMD(USERCOB)'
                3,'CMD(USERLNK)'
                4,'CMD(PLTCMPR)'
                5,'PANEL(PSWDSEL)'
                6,'CMD(S1ASM1)'
                7,'CMD(S1OBJ1)'
                8,'CMD(GENER1)'
              ' ',' '
                *,'?' )
)END

USERSELB.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%------------------  USER BACKGROUND OPTIONS SELECTION MENU  -------------------
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
%   1+- OS/VS COBOL COMPILER
%   2+- LINKAGE EDITOR
%   3+- SERIES 1 HOST ASSEMBLER
+
+ENTER OPTION TO CONTINUE GENERATING JCL
+ENTER%CANCEL+ON OPTION LINE TO EXIT WITHOUT SUBMITTING JOB
+PRESS%END KEY+TO SUBMIT JOB
+
+JOB STATEMENT INFORMATION:  (VERIFY BEFORE PROCEEDING)
%  ===>_JOB1                                                                   +
%  ===>_JOB2                                                                   +
%  ===>_JOB3                                                                   +
%  ===>_JOB4                                                                   +
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX = ISR91000 /* TUTORIAL INDEX - 1ST PAGE         */
)PROC
  &POPT = &ZCMD
  &ZSEL = TRANS( TRUNC (&ZCMD,'.')
                1,'CMD(USERCOBB)'
                2,'CMD(USERLNKB)'
                3,'CMD(S1ASM1B)'
           CANCEL,EXIT
              ' ',' '
                *,'?' )
)END

USERVTOC.text:
)ATTR
  +  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW) SKIP(ON)
  %  TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
  _  TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%---------------------------  VTOC UTILITY  ------------------------------------
%COMMAND%===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
%  PRINT OPTION ===>_P       +%NO OF COPIES IF P ===>_N1+
%                              SYSOUT CLASS      ===>_C1+
%    P -+PRINT VTOC ENTRIES
%    K -+DISPLAY VTOC ENTRIES AND SAVE DATASET
%    BLANK -+ DISPLAY VTOC ENTRIES
%
+   VOLUME SERIAL %===>_VOLLIST                           +
%
+   OPTIONS:
+     LEVEL       %===>_LEVEL                              +
+     CONTAINING  %===>_CONTAIN                            +
+     ENDING      %===>_ENDING  +
+     CATALOG CK? %===>_CAT +
+     SORT/NOSORT %===>_SRTFLDS                                     +
+                       KEYWORD   OPERATOR     VALUE
+     LIMIT1      %===>_KEYWD1+%===>_Z + %===>_VALUE1            +
+     LIMIT2      %===>_KEYWD2+%===>_Z + %===>_VALUE2            +
+     LIMIT3      %===>_KEYWD3+%===>_Z + %===>_VALUE3            +
+     LIMIT4      %===>_KEYWD4+%===>_Z + %===>_VALUE4            +
%
)INIT
  .ZVARS = '(OP1 OP2 OP3 OP4)'
  .HELP = TVTOC1
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX = ISR91000 /* TUTORIAL INDEX - 1ST PAGE         */
  &P = ' '
  &N1 = 1
  &C1 = A
  &LEVEL = ' '
  &CONTAIN = ' '
  &ENDING = ' '
  &SRTFLDS = ' '
  &VOLLIST = ' '
  &CAT = ' '
  &KEYWD1 = ' '
  &OP1 = ' '
  &VALUE1 = ' '
  &KEYWD2 = ' '
  &OP2 = ' '
  &VALUE2 = ' '
  &KEYWD3 = ' '
  &OP3 = ' '
  &VALUE3 = ' '
  &KEYWD4 = ' '
  &OP4 = ' '
  &VALUE4 = ' '
)PROC
  &P = TRUNC(&P,1)
  VER(&P,LIST,' ',P,K,MSG=VTOC000)
  IF (&P = P)
    &N1 = TRUNC(&N1,1)
    VER(&N1,NUM,MSG=VTOC001)
  VER(&VOLLIST,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC002)
  &CAT = TRUNC(&CAT,1)
  VER(&CAT,LIST,' ',Y,MSG=VTOC003)
  IF (&KEYWD1 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD1,LIST,ALLOC,UNUSED,USED,PCT,EX,DSO,RFM,BLKSZ,LRECL,
                CDATE,EXPDT,REFDT,SECT,PASS,ROUND,CCHH,VOLUME,DSNAME,
                CAT,MSG=VTOC004)
    &OP1 = TRUNC(&OP1,2)
    IF (&OP1 = '  ')
      VER(&OP1,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC005)
    IF (&OP1 ¬= '  ')
      VER(&OP1,LIST,'EQ','NE','LE','LT','GE','GT',MSG=VTOC005)
  IF (&KEYWD2 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD1,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC006)
  IF (&KEYWD2 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD2,LIST,ALLOC,UNUSED,USED,PCT,EX,DSO,RFM,BLKSZ,LRECL,
                CDATE,EXPDT,REFDT,SECT,PASS,ROUND,CCHH,VOLUME,DSNAME,
                CAT,MSG=VTOC004)
    &OP2 = TRUNC(&OP2,2)
    IF (&OP2 = '  ')
      VER(&OP2,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC005)
    IF (&OP2 ¬= '  ')
      VER(&OP2,LIST,'EQ','NE','LE','LT','GE','GT',MSG=VTOC005)
  IF (&KEYWD3 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD2,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC007)
  IF (&KEYWD3 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD1,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC007)
  IF (&KEYWD3 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD3,LIST,ALLOC,UNUSED,USED,PCT,EX,DSO,RFM,BLKSZ,LRECL,
                CDATE,EXPDT,REFDT,SECT,PASS,ROUND,CCHH,VOLUME,DSNAME,
                CAT,MSG=VTOC004)
    &OP3 = TRUNC(&OP3,2)
    IF (&OP3 = '  ')
      VER(&OP3,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC005)
    IF (&OP3 ¬= '  ')
      VER(&OP3,LIST,'EQ','NE','LE','LT','GE','GT',MSG=VTOC005)
  IF (&KEYWD4 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD3,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC008)
  IF (&KEYWD4 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD2,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC008)
  IF (&KEYWD4 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD1,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC008)
  IF (&KEYWD4 ¬= ' ')
    VER(&KEYWD4,LIST,ALLOC,UNUSED,USED,PCT,EX,DSO,RFM,BLKSZ,LRECL,
                CDATE,EXPDT,REFDT,SECT,PASS,ROUND,CCHH,VOLUME,DSNAME,
                CAT,MSG=VTOC004)
    &OP4 = TRUNC(&OP4,2)
    IF (&OP4 = '  ')
      VER(&OP4,NONBLANK,MSG=VTOC005)
    IF (&OP4 ¬= '  ')
      VER(&OP4,LIST,'EQ','NE','LE','LT','GE','GT',MSG=VTOC005)
)END

VTOC00.text:
VTOC000  'INVALID OPTION'            .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'OPTION MUST BE P FOR PRINT OR BLANK FOR BROWSE OR K FOR KEEP.'

VTOC001  'INVALID NO OF COPIES'      .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'NUMBER OF COPIES MUST BE NUMERIC'

VTOC002  'ENTER VOLSER'              .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'ENTER VOLUME SERIAL OR ''ALL'' FOR ALL VOLUMES'

VTOC003  'INVALID VALUE'             .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'CATALOG CHECK MUST BE BLANK FOR NONE OR YES'

VTOC004  'INVALID KEYWORD'           .HELP=TVTOCK    .ALARM=YES
'FOR A LIST OF VALID KEYWORDS USE HELP'

VTOC005  'INVALID OPERATOR'          .HELP=TVTOCO    .ALARM=YES
'VALID OPERATORS ARE: EQ, NE, LE, LT, GE, OR GT'

VTOC006  'INVALID LIMIT2 SEQUENCE'   .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'LIMIT1 MUST BE SPECIFIED BEFORE LIMIT2'

VTOC007  'INVALID LIMIT3 SEQUENCE'   .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'LIMIT2 MUST BE SPECIFIED BEFORE LIMIT3'

VTOC008  'INVALID LIMIT4 SEQUENCE'   .HELP=TVTOC1    .ALARM=YES
'LIMIT3 MUST BE SPECIFIED BEFORE LIMIT4'
